Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Dead Sea Scrolls, their literary and historical context, and significance.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A textual-thematic study of Book of Job in English translation, exploring the Book of Job as literature, theodicy and ethics.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Hebrew Bible (Old Testament, in translation) in historical, social, religious, cultural and literary contexts.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Scriptures, post-Biblical Rabbinic writings, Exegesis, Apocrypha, Qumran documents, Mishnah, Talmud, the Siddur, as well as Jewish mystical writings.

JST3100 - The Hebrew Bible as Literature.name: JST3100 - The Hebrew Bible as Literature

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the creative expression of Hebrew civilization as found in the Hebrew Bible, and its interpretation in the Apocrypha and Pseudepigrapha, the Mishna and the Talmud.

JST3149 - The Jewish View of Jesus.name: JST3149 - The Jewish View of Jesus

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of how Jewish scholarship approaches the "historical Jesus" and early Judaeo-Christianity, particularly with regard to the ancient land of Israel.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or better in ENC 1102, or C.I..

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of the concept of social justice among the Biblical prophets.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A comprehensive study of the Holocaust from 1933-1945, discussing the persecution of German Jews and the annihilation of the Jews in Europe.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Reading in literature depicting the modern Jewish experience in the past 150 years in the Jewish transition from ghetto and traditional life to modernity in Europe, America and pre-state Israel

JST4160 - History of the Talmud: Law and.name: JST4160 - History of the Talmud: Law and Ethics

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or EUH 2000, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history of the Talmud, and Talmudic texts and ethics; the Talmud as foundation of rabbinic law, and its application to problems past and present.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of the relationship between Judaism and modern science, including biblical, rabbinic and mystical teachings, with a focus on creation, cosmology and human life.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the relationship (in theory and practice) between two Abrahamic faiths, Judaism and Islam, including conflicts and commonalities between them.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Jewish presence in America and its influence on and contribution to American life and culture.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History and culture of the Jewish people from the beginnings of Judaism in the biblical era through the Graeco-Roman and rabbinic periods.

JST3402 - Jewish People in the Common Er.name: JST3402 - Jewish People in the Common Era

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history and culture of the Jewish People during the last two millennia, including the Muslim conquest to the rise of modern Israel.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of Israel as a nation, including elements of nation building, the role of religion, culture, science, hi-tech and higher education.

JST3481 - 20th Century Jewish History an.name: JST3481 - 20th Century Jewish History and Thought

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of philosophers such as Buber, Rosenzweig, Kaplan, Heschel, Borowitz, Solovechik, within the historical context of European immigration to the U.S.

JST3620 - Contemporary Jewish Ethics and.name: JST3620 - Contemporary Jewish Ethics and Morality

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Moral concerns using the resources of the classical Judaic tradition.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Jewish mysticism from its early roots in the prophetic age through the flowering of Kabbalah in medieval Spain and the land of Israel, with its texts and the Zohar.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the traumatic experience of the Holocaust in Europe as expressed and depicted in contemporary Jewish and Hebrew Literature.

JST3510 - Notable Women in Jewish Histor.name: JST3510 - Notable Women in Jewish History

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Historical and cultural role of exceptional women in Judaism.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores the key concepts and practices of the Jewish faith in a contemporary setting, emphasizing the changing nature of religious thought and observance.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines archaeological excavations in Israel and the ancient Near East to shed light on events and stories recorded in the Bible.

JST3551 - The Holy and the Profane: The.name: JST3551 - The Holy and the Profane: The Introduction of Secularism into Modern Judaism

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines cultural, religious, and social processes from traditional Judaism to the beginning of secularism in 18th-19th century European Jewry by studying Hebrew & Jewish Enlightenment.

JST3803 - The Israeli Experience in Shor.name: JST3803 - The Israeli Experience in Short Stories

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Israeli experience in contemporary short stories. Themes include Judaism - Past & Present; War & Peace; Society; the Holocaust; the Kibbutz and Israeli reality.

JST3126 - Romantic Love in the Bible.name: JST3126 - Romantic Love in the Bible

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The dimensions of romantic love in the Hebrew Bible, focusing on the depiction of human feelings of love and relationship; the nature of man-woman interactions in ancient Israel.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of the State of Israel: Political and ideological struggle for the establishment of the State of Israel, with emphasis on forces which shaped contemporary Israeli society and politics.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Values, practices, and beliefs that define Judaism.
